intro: Lycianthes aceratia, commonly known as the acanthus leaf nightshade, is a species of flowering plant in the Solanaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a distinctive appearance resembling the leaves of the acanthus plant. The flowers are usually yellow or white, and the plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds.
